intro: Cryptocarya sericeotriplinervia, commonly known as the silky triple-veined cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy, lance-shaped leaves with three prominent veins on the underside. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. The fruit is a small, woody drupe that contains a single seed.
